qas.question: How many routes does Nanjing's airport run?
How many passengers did the airport service in 2013?
When did the airport open for business?
What airport was the primary airport before Lukou?

context: Nanjing's airport, <a0_0>Lukou International Airport<a0_0/>, serves both national and international flights. In 2013, Nanjing airport handled <a2_0>15,011,792 passengers<a2_0/> and 255,788.6 tonnes of freight. The airport currently has <a1_0>85 routes<a1_0/> to national and international destinations, which include Japan, Korea, Thailand, Malaysia, Singapore, USA and Germany. The airport is connected by a 29-kilometre (18 mi) highway directly to the city center, and is also linked to various intercity highways, making it accessible to the passengers from the surrounding cities. A railway Ninggao Intercity Line is being built to link the airport with Nanjing South Railway Station. Lukou Airport was opened on <a3_0>28 June 1997<a3_0/>, replacing <a4_0>Nanjing Dajiaochang Airport<a4_0/> as the main airport serving Nanjing. Dajiaochang Airport is still used as a military air base.
